name: sfchronicle
text:
When will our lives return to normal?

Here's what we know so far: https://t.co/DlcYGaYAKa

name: sfchronicle
text: Dueling critics make the case for whether or not to watch Christopher Nolan's new film, "Tenet." https://t.co/DJpl8Tx504

name: sfchronicle
text: The post-pandemic dining experience at San Francisco’s Chase Center is set to feel very futuristic. https://t.co/5pnqSPCzBr

name: sfchronicle
text: Plans to hold a Stephen Curry-hosted PGA Tour event at Harding Park absorbed a big hit Thursday, when the tour announced that Curry’s foundation will become the chief beneficiary of the Memorial Tournament in Dublin, Ohio. https://t.co/N4u4CqhuuB

name: sfchronicle
text:
The FBI is offering a $50,000 reward for information about an arson that burned a San Francisco church in September. 

https://t.co/NZSDontmt6

name: sfchronicle
text:
Rapid home coronavirus testing kits are finally coming to the Bay Area. But epidemiologists say the over-the counter tests may be too little, too late.

https://t.co/Ie2ZFQx9pL

name: sfchronicle
text:
It appears the 49ers will have starting running back Raheem Mostert when they visit the Cowboys.

https://t.co/0vqJ2InIqY

name: sfchronicle
text:
The lobbying ban that Gov. Newsom adopted for his political consultants does not include the type of “revolving door” prohibition that is standard in government service. 

That allows his advisers to return to lobbying as soon as he stops paying them.

https://t.co/Nc65KC7KL7

name: sfchronicle
text:
The investigator had a strong hunch. The timing of the two fires, so close together, was a hallmark of a category he knew well.

Serial arson.

https://t.co/gzpv1AIOvD

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Miss Ollie’s that fans have come to love over the past eight years in Oakland — with its pink walls, funky vibe and essay-inspiring skillet-fried chicken — is coming to end this month.

https://t.co/9mUso0NPLO

name: sfchronicle
text:
California set yet another record for single-day coronavirus deaths. New cases also hit another record high in a single day across California on Wednesday as the health crisis accelerates. 

https://t.co/2n1tHSaRlC

name: sfchronicle
text:
One rogue coyote is behind three separate attacks in the East Bay, according to DNA testing by California Fish and Wildlife officials. 

The agency said it has begun plans and operations to locate the “offending coyote.”

https://t.co/9slkE9MpY6

name: sfchronicle
text:
49ers' Brandon Aiyuk could enter a fraternity few NFL rookie wide receivers have ever joined: the 1,000-yard club.

https://t.co/Pr7YZlIbEA

name: sfchronicle
text:
After dropping 30 pounds and earning second team All-Big Ten honors as a junior with Ohio State, Kaleb Wesson is competing for the Warriors’ open two-way contract.

https://t.co/ixIsnHJnnE

name: sfchronicle
text: REVIEW: If you’re one of the people who waited to see @TENETFilm — who didn’t take the risk of going to a movie theater in a pandemic — consider your choice vindicated. https://t.co/5D3b7baYKF

name: sfchronicle
text: Fires are rarely set for one reason alone; instead, motivations fall across a spectrum: excitement or anger, revenge or sport, profit or crime concealment, control or heroism. https://t.co/5tO8jdBnDX

name: sfchronicle
text:
Cal Fire’s Mike Thompson suspected serial arson in a string of blazes in Lake County. And he and his fellow investigators identified a suspect: Damin Pashilk, a former inmate firefighter. 

But arsonists are hard to catch, the evidence burns up. 

https://t.co/z060SeNKxy

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
More than 30 Santa Clara County jail inmates have tested positive for the coronavirus and more than 30 sheriff’s office staff have also tested positive, officials said Thursday.

https://t.co/wBb90ZLfh8

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Ahwahnee Hotel in Yosemite National Park held a lavish Thanksgiving buffet with hundreds of people in the majestic hotel’s grand dining room as health officials pleaded with people to avoid large gatherings.

https://t.co/MTb7n0vokN

name: sfchronicle
text:
The organizers of the S.F. Sketchfest comedy festival will instead mark its 20th anniversary online with Festpocalypse!, a one-day virtual variety show and fundraiser featuring new performances, chats, game shows and more. 

https://t.co/rxOht9YDcL

name: sfchronicle
text:
California Rep. Katie Porter said Thursday that she is in quarantine after being exposed to someone who tested positive for the coronavirus.

https://t.co/QROsRiDfWK
